questions.text: What year was the original Super Mario Bros. released for the NES in Japan?
questions.explanation: Super Mario Bros. was released on September 13, 1985 in Japan for the Famicom (NES).

questions.text: Which company developed the original Sonic the Hedgehog game?
questions.explanation: Sonic the Hedgehog was developed by Sonic Team at Sega and released in 1991 for the Sega Genesis.

questions.text: In The Legend of Zelda series, what is the name of Link's signature sword?
questions.explanation: The Master Sword, also known as the Blade of Evil's Bane, is Link's iconic weapon throughout the Zelda series.

questions.text: What was the first commercially successful arcade video game?
questions.explanation: Pong, released by Atari in 1972, is widely considered the first commercially successful arcade video game.

questions.text: Which game studio created Minecraft?
questions.explanation: Minecraft was created by Markus 'Notch' Persson and developed by Mojang Studios, later acquired by Microsoft in 2014.

questions.text: What is the best-selling video game console of all time as of 2024?
questions.explanation: The PlayStation 2, with over 155 million units sold, remains the best-selling home console of all time.

questions.text: In Fortnite, what is the name of the in-game currency used to purchase items?
questions.explanation: V-Bucks (Vindertech Bucks) are the premium currency in Fortnite used to buy cosmetic items and the Battle Pass.

questions.text: Which classic arcade game features a yellow character eating dots in a maze?
questions.explanation: Pac-Man, created by Namco and released in 1980, features the iconic yellow character navigating a maze of dots.

questions.text: What is the name of Mario's brother in the Super Mario series?
questions.explanation: Luigi is Mario's younger, taller twin brother and has been a staple character since the original Mario Bros. in 1983.

questions.text: Which company developed Fortnite?
questions.explanation: Fortnite was developed by Epic Games and released in 2017, with its Battle Royale mode becoming a global phenomenon.

questions.text: What material in Minecraft is needed to create a Nether Portal?
questions.explanation: A Nether Portal requires at least 10 blocks of Obsidian arranged in a rectangular frame and lit with flint and steel.

questions.text: Which Nintendo console introduced motion controls as its primary input method?
questions.explanation: The Nintendo Wii, released in 2006, featured the Wii Remote with motion-sensing technology as its primary controller.

questions.text: In which year was the original PlayStation released in Japan?
questions.explanation: The original PlayStation was released in Japan on December 3, 1994 by Sony Computer Entertainment.

questions.text: What is the name of the main antagonist in the Legend of Zelda series?
questions.explanation: Ganondorf, also known as Ganon, is the primary recurring villain in The Legend of Zelda series.

questions.text: Which game is known for the phrase 'The cake is a lie'?
questions.explanation: The phrase 'The cake is a lie' became a famous meme originating from Valve's Portal, released in 2007.

questions.text: What is the rarest ore in standard Minecraft Survival mode?
questions.explanation: Ancient Debris, found in the Nether, is the rarest ore in Minecraft and is used to craft Netherite equipment.

questions.text: Which esports game features champions like Jinx, Yasuo, and Ahri?
questions.explanation: Jinx, Yasuo, and Ahri are all playable champions in League of Legends, developed by Riot Games.

questions.text: What was the name of the first Xbox console?
questions.explanation: The original Xbox was released by Microsoft in November 2001, marking Microsoft's entry into the console market.

questions.text: Which indie game features a small knight exploring the underground kingdom of Hallownest?
questions.explanation: Hollow Knight, developed by Team Cherry, is set in the underground kingdom of Hallownest and was released in 2017.

questions.text: What is the name of the princess Mario typically rescues?
questions.explanation: Princess Peach (originally called Princess Toadstool in Western releases) is the ruler of the Mushroom Kingdom.

questions.text: Which game developer is known for the Dark Souls series?
questions.explanation: FromSoftware, led by director Hidetaka Miyazaki, developed the Dark Souls series and popularized the 'Soulslike' genre.

questions.text: In which game do players fight to be the last one standing on an ever-shrinking island?
questions.explanation: All three games are battle royale titles where players compete on shrinking maps to be the last player or team standing.

questions.text: What year did the Nintendo Entertainment System (NES) launch in North America?
questions.explanation: The NES launched in North America in October 1985, helping to revive the video game industry after the 1983 crash.

questions.text: Which game features the fictional city of Los Santos?
questions.explanation: Los Santos is the primary setting of Grand Theft Auto V, inspired by the real city of Los Angeles.

questions.text: What is the highest-grossing video game franchise of all time?
questions.explanation: The Pokemon franchise, including games, merchandise, cards, and media, is the highest-grossing entertainment franchise ever.

questions.text: Which classic game requires players to arrange falling blocks called Tetrominoes?
questions.explanation: Tetris was created by Soviet software engineer Alexey Pajitnov in 1985 and features seven different Tetromino shapes.

questions.text: In Minecraft, what creature explodes when it gets close to the player?
questions.explanation: The Creeper is an iconic Minecraft mob that silently approaches players and explodes, destroying blocks in the area.

questions.text: Which company created the Game Boy?
questions.explanation: Nintendo released the Game Boy in 1989. Designed by Gunpei Yokoi, it became one of the most successful handhelds ever.

questions.text: What is the name of the protagonist in the Halo series?
questions.explanation: Master Chief, also known as John-117, is the supersoldier protagonist of the Halo franchise developed by Bungie and later 343 Industries.

questions.text: Which indie game features a mountain-climbing platformer with themes of anxiety and self-doubt?
questions.explanation: Celeste, developed by Maddy Makes Games, follows Madeline as she climbs Celeste Mountain while dealing with mental health themes.

questions.text: What does 'NPC' stand for in gaming terminology?
questions.explanation: NPC stands for Non-Player Character, referring to any character in a game not controlled by a human player.

questions.text: Which game studio developed The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt?
questions.explanation: CD Projekt Red, a Polish game studio, developed The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt, released in 2015 to critical acclaim.

questions.text: What is the name of the battle royale mode in Call of Duty?
questions.explanation: Call of Duty: Warzone is the free-to-play battle royale mode, first released in March 2020.

questions.text: Which console launched with the game Halo: Combat Evolved?
questions.explanation: Halo: Combat Evolved was a launch title for the original Xbox in November 2001 and was critical to the console's success.

questions.text: In Super Smash Bros., which character is known as the 'King of Dreamland'?
questions.explanation: King Dedede is the self-proclaimed King of Dream Land in the Kirby series and a fighter in Super Smash Bros.

questions.text: Which game popularized the 'loot box' controversy in 2017?
questions.explanation: Star Wars Battlefront II's pay-to-win loot box system sparked massive backlash in 2017 and led to industry-wide scrutiny.

questions.text: What is the final boss in standard Minecraft Survival mode?
questions.explanation: The Ender Dragon is the main boss of Minecraft, found in The End dimension, and defeating it rolls the game's credits.

questions.text: Which Pokemon was the mascot of the Pokemon franchise?
questions.explanation: Pikachu has been the official mascot of the Pokemon franchise since the anime series began in 1997.

questions.text: What is the name of Valve's digital game distribution platform?
questions.explanation: Steam, launched by Valve in 2003, is the largest digital distribution platform for PC gaming.

questions.text: Which game introduced the concept of a 'Battle Pass' that became an industry standard?
questions.explanation: Dota 2 introduced the 'Compendium' (later called Battle Pass) in 2013 for The International tournament, predating Fortnite's version.

questions.text: What was the Sega Genesis known as in Japan?
questions.explanation: The Sega Genesis was called the Mega Drive in Japan and most regions outside North America.

questions.text: Which game features agents like Jett, Sage, and Phoenix?
questions.explanation: Valorant, developed by Riot Games and released in 2020, features agents with unique abilities in a tactical shooter format.

questions.text: Who is the creator of the Metal Gear Solid series?
questions.explanation: Hideo Kojima created the Metal Gear series and directed the Metal Gear Solid games at Konami before founding Kojima Productions.

questions.text: What year did the Nintendo Switch launch?
questions.explanation: The Nintendo Switch was released worldwide on March 3, 2017, featuring both handheld and docked TV modes.

questions.text: In Among Us, what are the impostors trying to do?
questions.explanation: In Among Us, impostors secretly sabotage and eliminate crewmates while trying to avoid being identified and ejected.

questions.text: Which game studio is known for creating The Elder Scrolls and Fallout series?
questions.explanation: Bethesda Game Studios developed The Elder Scrolls series (including Skyrim) and Fallout 3, 4, and 76.

questions.text: What is the name of the green-clad protagonist in The Legend of Zelda?
questions.explanation: Link is the protagonist of The Legend of Zelda series, often mistakenly called Zelda by those unfamiliar with the games.

questions.text: Which esports tournament has the largest prize pool funded by the community?
questions.explanation: The International, Dota 2's premier tournament, has featured record-breaking community-funded prize pools exceeding $40 million.

questions.text: What was the first game in the Final Fantasy series originally designed to be?
questions.explanation: Final Fantasy was named because creator Hironobu Sakaguchi considered it his last game before leaving the industry; its success saved Square.

questions.text: Which handheld console introduced dual screens, with one being a touchscreen?
questions.explanation: The Nintendo DS (Dual Screen), released in 2004, featured two screens with the bottom one being a touchscreen.

questions.text: In Street Fighter II, what is the name of the fireball attack performed by Ryu?
questions.explanation: The Hadouken (wave motion fist) is Ryu's iconic fireball projectile attack in the Street Fighter series.

questions.text: Which company acquired Activision Blizzard in 2023?
questions.explanation: Microsoft completed its acquisition of Activision Blizzard in October 2023 for approximately $69 billion.

questions.text: What is the name of the blocky building game created by the Roblox Corporation?
questions.explanation: Roblox is a platform where users can create and play games made by other users, launched in 2006 by Roblox Corporation.

questions.text: Which game is credited with starting the modern battle royale genre?
questions.explanation: While earlier games had similar concepts, PUBG (2017) by Brendan 'PlayerUnknown' Greene is credited with popularizing the standalone battle royale genre.

questions.text: What is the name of the protagonist in the God of War series?
questions.explanation: Kratos is the Spartan warrior protagonist of the God of War series, created by Santa Monica Studio.

questions.text: Which 1993 game is considered the grandfather of first-person shooters?
questions.explanation: While Wolfenstein 3D came first, Doom (1993) by id Software is widely credited with popularizing and defining the FPS genre.

questions.text: In Minecraft, what do you need to tame a wolf?
questions.explanation: Players can tame wolves in Minecraft by feeding them bones, which have a chance to turn the wolf into a pet dog.

questions.text: Which indie game lets you befriend monsters instead of fighting them?
questions.explanation: Undertale, created by Toby Fox in 2015, allows players to complete the entire game without killing any enemies through its mercy system.

questions.text: What gaming peripheral did Nintendo release for the Wii that tracked body motion?
questions.explanation: The Wii Balance Board, released with Wii Fit in 2007, tracked the player's balance and body weight for fitness games.

questions.text: Which game features the phrase 'War. War never changes.'?
questions.explanation: The phrase 'War. War never changes.' is the iconic opening narration of the Fallout series, first used in Fallout (1997).

questions.text: What is the name of the competitive Pokemon battle format used in official tournaments?
questions.explanation: VGC (Video Game Championships) is the official competitive Pokemon format, using double battles with specific rulesets.

questions.text: Which game studio developed Stardew Valley?
questions.explanation: Stardew Valley was entirely developed by one person, Eric Barone (ConcernedApe), over four years, released in 2016.

questions.text: What was the first home console to use a CD-ROM instead of cartridges?
questions.explanation: The TurboGrafx-CD (PC Engine CD-ROM), released in 1988, was the first home console to use CD-ROM as its primary media.

questions.text: In the game Counter-Strike, what side plants the bomb?
questions.explanation: In Counter-Strike, the Terrorist side is tasked with planting the bomb at designated sites, while Counter-Terrorists must defuse it.

questions.text: Which Nintendo character is a bounty hunter in a power suit?
questions.explanation: Samus Aran is the protagonist of the Metroid series, a bounty hunter wearing an iconic Power Suit created by the Chozo.

questions.text: What does 'FPS' stand for in gaming?
questions.explanation: FPS has two common meanings in gaming: First-Person Shooter (a genre) and Frames Per Second (a performance metric).

questions.text: Which game was the launch title that helped sell millions of Nintendo 64 consoles?

options.C: The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time

questions.explanation: Super Mario 64, released alongside the Nintendo 64 in 1996, was a revolutionary 3D platformer and a system-selling launch title.

questions.text: What color is Sonic the Hedgehog?
questions.explanation: Sonic the Hedgehog is blue, chosen by Sega to match their company's cobalt blue logo color.

questions.text: Which game is known for 'Creepers', 'Endermen', and 'Redstone'?
questions.explanation: Creepers, Endermen, and Redstone are all iconic elements of Minecraft, each being unique to the game.

questions.text: Which company developed Overwatch?
questions.explanation: Overwatch was developed by Blizzard Entertainment and released in 2016 as a team-based hero shooter.

questions.text: What was the infamous 'Red Ring of Death' associated with?
questions.explanation: The Red Ring of Death was a hardware failure indicated by three red lights on the Xbox 360, affecting millions of units.

questions.text: Which game features a blocky world where players can build and survive on floating islands called 'Skyblock'?
questions.explanation: Skyblock is one of the most popular Minecraft survival maps, where players start on a small floating island with limited resources.

questions.text: Who is considered the 'Father of Video Games'?
questions.explanation: Ralph Baer is widely regarded as the 'Father of Video Games' for creating the Magnavox Odyssey, the first home console, in 1972.

questions.text: Which game's protagonist is known for saying 'It's-a me!'?
questions.explanation: Mario's catchphrase 'It's-a me, Mario!' voiced by Charles Martinet, became one of gaming's most recognizable lines.

questions.text: What does the acronym 'RPG' stand for in gaming?
questions.explanation: RPG stands for Role-Playing Game, a genre where players assume the roles of characters in a fictional setting.

questions.text: Which indie game features procedurally generated levels and permadeath in a dungeon-crawling roguelike?
questions.explanation: Hades, Spelunky, and Enter the Gungeon are all roguelike/roguelite games featuring procedural generation and permadeath.

questions.text: What was the code name for the Nintendo Wii during development?
questions.explanation: The Nintendo Wii was developed under the code name 'Revolution' before being officially named Wii in 2006.

questions.text: Which game studio is known for developing Animal Crossing?
questions.explanation: Animal Crossing is developed by Nintendo's Entertainment Planning & Development division (Nintendo EPD).

questions.text: In esports, what does 'GG' typically mean?
questions.explanation: GG stands for 'Good Game' and is a common sportsmanship phrase used at the end of competitive matches in esports.

questions.text: Which 2020 game became a massive hit during the COVID-19 pandemic, featuring island life simulation?

options.A: The Last of Us Part II

questions.explanation: Animal Crossing: New Horizons launched on the Nintendo Switch in March 2020 and became a cultural phenomenon during pandemic lockdowns.
